snippet: On the verge of a seventh consecutive year of drought, California needs a wet winter nearly as much as a lift in its economy. It also needs to shed an archaic water policy.   California is closer to water policy reforms than ever, thanks largely t...
lead_paragraph: On the verge of a seventh consecutive year of drought, California needs a wet winter nearly as much as a lift in its economy. It also needs to shed an archaic water policy. California is closer to water policy reforms than ever, thanks largely to Senator Bill Bradley, the New Jersey Democrat. He proposes creating a free market for water in which price, not policy, would determine how much would be used on farms and how much in cities.
